bug.short_desc: Desktop Icons disappearing if position changed and stored on file ~/.config/nemo/desktop-metadata
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1225058 x startp log
Description of problem:
On each login all desktop icons that has been moved and also stored its position on file ~/.config/nemo/desktop-metadata are hidden.
After I execute the command "gsettings set org.nemo.desktop show-desktop-icons true" they are visible again until next login.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): System: Host: nadhh.nadisoft Kernel: 4.8.8-300.fc25.x86_64 x86_64 (64 bit gcc: 6.2.1) Desktop: Cinnamon 3.2.1 (Gtk 3.22.2) dm: lightdm,sddm,sddm Distro: Fedora release 25 (Twenty Five) Machine: Device: desktop Mobo: ASRock model: X79 Extreme4 UEFI: American Megatrends v: P3.70 date: 02/13/2014 CPU: Quad core Intel Core 1245 MHz 7: 1203 MHz 8: 1215 MHz Graphics: Card: NVIDIA GF108 [GeForce GT 620] bus-ID: 02:00.0 chip-ID: 10de:0f01 Display Server: Fedora X.org 119 drivers: nouveau (unloaded: fbdev,vesa) Resolution: 1920x1080@60.00hz, 1280x1024@60.02hz GLX Renderer: Gallium 0.4 on NVC1 GLX Version: 3.0 Mesa 12.0.3 Direct Rendering: Yes Audio: Card-1 NVIDIA GF108 High Definition Audio Controller driver: Mbps duplex: full mac: <filter> Card-2: Realtek RTL8111/8168/8411 PCI Express Gigabit Ethernet Controller driver: r8169 v: 2.3LK-NAPI port: c000 bus-ID: 09:00.0 chip-ID: 10ec:8168 IF: enp9s0 state: up speed: 100 Mbps duplex: full mac: <filter> Drives: HDD Total Size: 4000.8GB (5.0% used) ID-1: /dev/sda model: ST500DM002 size: 500.1GB serial: Z6EPH4KW ID-2: /dev/sdb model: ST500DM002 size: 500.1GB serial: Z6EPCNN7 ID-3: /dev/sdc model: ST500DM002 size: 500.1GB serial: Z6EPJW1Y ID-4: /dev/sdd model: ST500DM002 size: 500.1GB serial: Z6EPJ6CW ID-5: USB /dev/sde model: HDS722020ALA330 size: /dev/md127 - inactive components: online: none spare: sdc[3] sda[2] sdb[1] sdd[0] Unused Devices: none Sensors: System Temperatures: cpu: 47.0C mobo: N/A gpu: 46.0 Fan Speeds (in rpm): cpu: N/A Repos: Active yum sources in file: /etc/yum.repos.d/adobe-linux-x86_64.repo adobe-linux-x86_64 ~ http: //linuxdownload.adobe.com/linux/x86_64/ Active yum sources in file: /etc/yum.repos.d/fedora-arm-linux-gnueabihf.repo lantw44-arm-linux-gnueabihf-toolchain ~ https: //copr-be.cloud.fedoraproject.org/results/lantw44/arm-linux-gnueabihf-toolchain/fedora-$releasever-$basearch/ Info: Processes: 298 Uptime: 48 min Memory: 1803.6/32124.6MB Init: systemd v: 231 runlevel: 5 default: graphical.target Gcc sys: 6.2.1 Client: Unknown python2.7 client inxi: 2.3.3
How reproducible: Set Desktop Icons visible and follow
Steps to Reproduce: 1. remove ~/.config/nemo/desktop-metadata and logout/login All Icons excepting those are automatically stored on ~/.config/nemo/desktop-metadata are visible.
2. execut "gsettings set org.nemo.desktop show-desktop-icons true" to make all icons (those are stored on file desktop-metadata too) visible. 3. Move some user icons to let them stored on desktop-metadata too and logout.
4. After login all moved iconst are not visible until call "gsettings set org.nemo.desktop show-desktop-icons true" See positin 1
Actual results:
Desktop-icons that are configured by file ~/.config/nemo/desktop-metadata are hidden.
Expected results: All Desktop-icons should be visible.
Additional info:

The issue doesn't reproduce here, my icons are all visible at all times without any need to run gsettings.

cinnamon-3.4.2-1.fc25, cinnamon-desktop-3.4.2-1.fc25, cinnamon-screensaver-3.4.1-1.fc25, cinnamon-session-3.4.1-1.fc25, cinnamon-settings-daemon-3.4.2-1.fc25, nemo-3.4.3-2.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. cinnamon-3.4.2-1.fc25, cinnamon-desktop-3.4.2-1.fc25, cinnamon-screensaver-3.4.1-1.fc25, cinnamon-session-3.4.1-1.fc25, cinnamon-settings-daemon-3.4.2-1.fc25, nemo-3.4.3-2.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

At my workstation thit bug has been gone :) Sometimes (seldom) if I log-in then icons will be all placed in grid on the left side of the secondare screen. Then I have to move them as I like to be placed. This secondore screen is placed on the left side and has a different resolution than the primary on the right.
[juergen@nadhh ~]$ uname -a Linux nadhh.fritz.box 4.11.5-200.fc25.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Jun 14 17:17:29 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux [juergen@nadhh ~]$
